intro: Palicourea sphaerocephala, commonly known as the globe-headed palicourea, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, rounded inflorescences. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small, clustered, and often have a yellow or white coloration, contributing to its ornamental value.
